author: Ella Boyd
title: Powder Party: The Sierra Pick Up Nearly Two Feet Of Snow
text:
The snow in Tahoe is good. I say that as a born-and-bred East Coaster, but trust me, it's a lot better than it was in early December (when things were so sparse you could see the dirt under your skis!)
With the last couple of storms (the last storm still going on, there's snow coming this Saturday too) the base has increased tremendously, to the point where you can get away without tuning your skis. Shouts to everyone who used their rock skis and saved themselves $70 instead of Ptexing their bases those first few weeks!
üåπRose Report: BLUEBIRD
‚ùÑÔ∏è| 18-20" overnight
5¬∞F - Wind 15-22 W - Sunny
üõó Zephyr - Scheduled 8:30am
üõó Northwest - Scheduled 9am
üõó Lakeview - Scheduled 9am
üõó Galena - Scheduled 9am
üõó Wizard - Scheduled 9am
üõª| Chains or Snow Tires required on 431 - Roads are slick - Be Safe
‚Äî MtRoseSkiTahoe (@MtRoseSkiTahoe) January 11, 2024 Mt. Rose got 18-20" overnight, not surprising as Mt. Rose is Tahoe's highest base elevation ski resort. It seems like there's always snow over there!
Palisades Tahoe didn't do too badly itself. 3 inches overnight and 14 inches over the last 24 hours? We'll take it.
Family friendly Northstar saw 15 inches over the last 24 hours, with 17 inches in the last 48.
Powder-famous Heavenly saw 19 inches over the last day, but that's the least of their good news: their gondola also resumes operations tomorrow!
Related: Heavenly Resort Plans To Reopen Essential Gondola Tomorrow
Sugar Bowl got 10 inches at their summit in the last 24 hours, and their base got 6 inches (not too shabby)!
The Sugar Bowl snow reporter noted that powder hounds should "get it quick before the next storm rolls in on Saturday," (my thoughts exactly, when the vis is bad, there's not a lot of fun to be had...) "see y'all in the lift lines!"
The natural, terrain-filled Kirkwood got 7 inches in the last day, and 8 in the last two.
Boreal , famous for its night skiing and terrain park, got 9 inches overnight. That will stoke out those park rats (or not, because they have to reshape all the jumps).
Down south a little, Mammoth Mountain's snow report accounts for 14-16 inches of fresh powder overnight, with 14 inches at the Main Lodge today.
The nearby, mellow June Mountain also got hit with the latest storm, with 6 inches in the last 24 hours.
Where are you most excited to ski? Me, I'm just stoked to be able to spray some snow when doing hockey stops at the base of the lifts. It's been awhile!
Related: One Skier Killed, One Injured By In-Bounds Avalanche At Palisades Tahoe

author: PTI
title: ULFA signs peace accord with Centre, Assam government agreeing to shun violence ‚Äì ThePrint ‚Äì PTI
text:
Home India ULFA signs peace accord with Centre, Assam government agreeing to shun violence India ULFA signs peace accord with Centre, Assam government agreeing to shun violence The agreement, signed in presence of Amit Shah and Himanta Biswa Sarma, came after 12 years of unconditional negotiations between the ULFA faction and govt. PTI 29 December, 2023 05:30 pm IST Facebook Twitter WhatsApp Linkedin An ULFA (I) Training camp in Myanmar (2016) | By special arrangement Text Size: A- A+
New Delhi: The pro-talks faction of the United Liberation Front of Asom (ULFA) on Friday signed a peace accord with the central and Assam governments agreeing to shun violence and join the mainstream.
The agreement, signed in the presence of Union Home Minister Amit Shah and Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, came after 12 years of unconditional negotiations between the ULFA faction led by Arabinda Rajkhowa and the government, officials said.
The peace pact is expected to end decades old insurgency in Assam.
Show Full Article
However, the hardline faction of the ULFA headed by Paresh Baruah is not part of the agreement. Baruah is believed to be residing at a place along the China-Myanmar border.
The ULFA was formed in 1979 with the demand for a ‚Äúsovereign Assam‚Äù. Since then, it has been involved in subversive activities that led to the central government declaring it a banned outfit in 1990.
The Rajkhowa faction joined peace talks with the government on September 3, 2011, after an agreement for Suspension of Operations (SoO) was signed between it and central and state governments. PTI ACB ANB ANB
This report is auto-generated from PTI news service. ThePrint holds no responsibility for its content.

author: KalingaTV Bureau
title: Delhi wakes up to dense fog this morning as cold wave grips; flights diverted
text:
New Delhi: Dense fog engulfed the national capital as cold waves gripped the city on Friday morning.
According to the India Meteorological Department, Delhi recorded 9.6 degrees Celsius at 5.30 am on Friday. The air quality in the national capital has deteriorated from ‚Äòpoor‚Äô to ‚Äòvery poor‚Äô.
According to the Central Pollution Control Board, the AQI was recorded at 348 in Delhi today at 6 am.
An AQI between zero and 50 is considered ‚Äògood,‚Äô 51 and 100 ‚Äòsatisfactory,‚Äô 101 and 200 ‚Äòmoderate,‚Äô 201 and 300 ‚Äòpoor,‚Äô 301 and 400 ‚Äòvery poor,‚Äô and 401 and 500 ‚Äòsevere.‚Äô
Meanwhile, as the temperature dips, homeless people in the city increasingly rely on night shelters.
The Delhi Urban Shelter Improvement Board (DUSIB) has also set up 235 pagoda tents to shelter homeless people. Night shelters have been set up in several areas of the national capital, including AIIMS, Lodhi Road, and Nizamuddin flyover.
In response to the chilly weather, residents of the capital were seen gathering around bonfires, while others took shelter in night homes as temperatures continued to drop.
On Friday, North Indian states continued to face harsh winter conditions. Uttar Pradesh‚Äôs capital Lucknow, the temperature is recorded at 8 degrees Celsius at 3.30 am. The local administrations have set up temporary shelter homes for the homeless people. UP‚Äôs Aligarh people were seen taking refuge in one of these shelters.
In Jammu and Kashmir‚Äôs capital Srinagar, the temperature was recorded at -1.3 degrees Celsius at 5.30 am.
Meanwhile, airline carrier Indigo on Thursday issued a travel advisory for its flight operations in Srinagar as the region was experiencing snowfall impacting flight schedules.
‚ÄúWe wish the snowfall could take a brief pause, allowing us to ensure smooth travels for you once again. Stay warm and stay informed,‚Äù the airlines stated.
In Rajasthan‚Äôs capital Jaipur, the temperature was recorded at 10.2 degrees Celsius at 5.30 am today.
Rajasthan Chief Minister Bhajanlal Sharma visited the winter shelter homes set up near Gandhinagar Railway Station here on Thursday night to take stock of the arrangements.
The Chief Minister was seen interacting with the homeless people and distributing blankets to them.
Bhajanlal Sharma said that ‚Äúgood arrangements‚Äù are made in the night shelter homes.
‚ÄúNo one should face any problem, I have mentioned this to all of you. Also through ‚ÄòChief Minister Sadbhavna Kendra‚Äô all our people are helping. Our municipality has built night shelter homes and they have made very good arrangements. No one must face any problem,‚Äù Sharma told reporters after taking stock of the arrangements in the night shelters.
(Source: ANI)
Also Read: Free for wife but double for husband: Karnataka LoP Ashoka on KSRTC bus fare hike

author: @merca2_es
title: Se l√≠a parda con Coca Cola, la IA y un pol√©mico anuncio de Navidad
text:
Desde hace aproximadamente dos a√±os, la inteligencia artificial (IA) ha estado evolucionando de forma r√°pida no, lo siguiente . Como prueba de ello tenemos lo que ha hecho Coca Cola hace poco, cuando realiz√≥ el lanzamiento de su ya tradicional anuncio navide√±o de cara a las pr√≥ximas fiestas. B√°sicamente, a todos los temores que viene levantando esta tecnolog√≠a con respecto a si pondr√° o no en peligro cierta cantidad de trabajos , luego de ver este anuncio debemos agregarle el correspondiente a la labor de los publicistas .
Despu√©s de que Sam Altman , director ejecutivo de OpenAI, la compa√±√≠a responsable de ChatGPT, afirmara que es posible conseguir la inteligencia artificial general con hardware actual, es decir, que en menos tiempo del esperado estaremos viendo c√≥mo la IA es capaz de realizar tareas intelectuales de la misma forma o incluso mejor que los seres humanos , ahora nos topamos con el pol√©mico anuncio navide√±o de Coca Cola, el cual ha sido creado 100 % con inteligencia artificial .
¬øCoca Cola ¬´anuncia¬ª el fin de los publicistas? Recientemente Coca Cola ha publicado en su canal de YouTube su nuevo anuncio de Navidad , el cual tiene como protagonista expl√≠cito a la Coca Cola Zero ; y decimos ¬´expl√≠cito¬ª porque el verdadero personaje principal de esta propaganda es la inteligencia artificial , la cual ha sido empleada para crear la totalidad del archivo audiovisual.
Tal y como se puede apreciar en el v√≠deo, el nuevo anuncio navide√±o que ha sido generado por la IA empieza con los cl√°sicos camiones de la empresa de bebidas llegando al hogar de Santa Claus. Luego, a lo largo del cortometraje es posible ver c√≥mo este personaje le va entregando una botella de Coca Cola Zero a varias personas. Sin embargo, lo m√°s llamativo de esta producci√≥n es lo realistas que se ven los supuestos seres vivos que intervienen , pues a simple vista tanto los osos polares como las personas parecen estar hechas de carne y hueso .
La primera piedra de un gran cambio Tengamos algo claro: a Coca Cola le sobran los recursos econ√≥micos para contratar a todo el equipo necesario para realizar un anuncio de cara a la Navidad. Por ende, si no lo ha hecho y ha decidido apostar 100 % por la inteligencia artificial es porque, por un lado, quiere llamar la atenci√≥n (y lo est√° consiguiendo), y por otro, desea ser recordada como la primera gran compa√±√≠a que ¬´reemplaz√≥¬ª a los publicistas por la tecnolog√≠a que m√°s est√° de moda por estos d√≠as.
Por lo anterior, lo hecho por esta multinacional le abre las puertas a la posibilidad de que, de aqu√≠ en adelante, diferentes empresas mundialmente reconocidas empiecen a copiar el m√©todo de Coca Cola a la hora de crear sus propios anuncios . No nos enga√±emos, la idea no resulta para nada alocada: de esta forma, las compa√±√≠as lograr√°n ahorrarse una gran cantidad de dinero y conseguir√°n que cada producci√≥n quede exactamente como desean , pues por muy avanzada que est√© la IA, todav√≠a sigue estando bajo el control humano‚Ä¶ al menos por ahora.

author: JD Supra Perspectives
title: Legal Prompt Engineering: Fast Becoming the Important AI Skill in Legal Services
text: In the ever-evolving landscape of legal practice, a new skill is swiftly becoming indispensable for lawyers: prompt engineering. As generative artificial intelligence continues to reshape industries, the legal sector is no exception. The ability to effectively communicate with AI systems through well-crafted prompts is not just a technical skill ‚Äì it‚Äôs a bridge to a future where lawyers and AI collaborate to achieve greater heights in the pursuit of justice. The legal profession, steeped in tradition and precedent, is now at the forefront of a technological revolution. Generative AI, with its ability to analyze vast amounts of data and generate insightful content, is rapidly becoming a vital tool for legal professionals. From drafting documents to legal research, AI's capabilities are vast. However, to harness these capabilities fully, lawyers must become adept in the art of prompt engineering. Prompt engineering is the skill of crafting queries and instructions that guide AI to produce the desired output. It's a nuanced balance of clarity, specificity, and creativity. For lawyers, mastering this skill means they can efficiently leverage AI to draft contracts, prepare legal briefs, or sift through case law and legislations. A well-crafted prompt can be the difference between a generic response and a nuanced, contextually relevant output that can aid legal decision-making. Lawyers can spend more time on complex legal strategies ... while AI handles the heavy lifting of data processing and preliminary drafting. Lawyers can spend more time on complex legal strategies ... while AI handles the heavy lifting of data processing and preliminary drafting. Imagine a world where lawyers can delegate routine tasks like legal research, document review, and even some aspects of due diligence to AI. With effective prompt engineering, this is not a distant dream but a present reality. Lawyers can spend more time on complex legal strategies, client interaction, and courtroom advocacy, while AI handles the heavy lifting of data processing and preliminary drafting. The future of law is not about replacing lawyers with machines but about creating a synergy between human and machine intelligence. Lawyers equipped with prompt engineering skills can guide AI to work in ways that complement their expertise. This partnership allows for a more comprehensive analysis, innovative solutions, and ultimately, a higher standard of legal service. ...those who can skillfully interact with AI will have a distinct advantage. ...those who can skillfully interact with AI will have a distinct advantage. For many lawyers, prompt engineering is a new frontier. It requires a mindset shift from traditional legal training to a more tech-centric approach. However, this learning curve is an opportunity to be at the cutting edge of legal innovation, to expand one‚Äôs toolkit, and to stay competitive in a rapidly changing legal landscape. As lawyers engage more with generative AI, ethical considerations come to the fore. Understanding the limitations and biases of AI is crucial. Prompt engineering is not just about extracting the best response from AI but also about ensuring that the AI's output aligns with ethical standards and legal requirements. Lawyers must be vigilant and discerning, using their judgment to filter AI-generated content. Legal education institutions have a pivotal role in preparing the next generation of lawyers for this AI-augmented future. Incorporating courses on AI, data analytics, and prompt engineering in the legal curriculum is essential. Lawyers need to be as fluent in technology as they are in legal theory and practice. The impact of AI and prompt engineering in law is not confined to a single jurisdiction. It's a global phenomenon, with the potential to transform legal systems worldwide. Lawyers who master prompt engineering can collaborate across borders more effectively, accessing and analyzing international legal databases with ease and efficiency. For today‚Äôs lawyers and law students, learning prompt engineering is akin to future-proofing their careers. As AI becomes more embedded in legal practice, those who can skillfully interact with AI will have a distinct advantage. They will be the innovators, the leaders, the ones shaping the future of the legal profession. ...learning prompt engineering also serves to strengthen a lawyer‚Äôs core analytical skills. ...learning prompt engineering also serves to strengthen a lawyer‚Äôs core analytical skills. Mastering prompt engineering is a journey. It begins with understanding the basics of AI and evolves into developing the skill to craft prompts that yield relevant, accurate, and ethically sound outputs. This journey is one of continuous learning and adaptation, reflecting the dynamic nature of both the legal field and technological advancement. The journey to mastery of prompt engineering is not a solitary one. It involves collaboration and community. Lawyers, technologists, and AI experts must work together to explore the capabilities and boundaries of AI in law. Through forums, workshops, and professional networks, legal professionals can share insights, strategies, and best practices for effective prompt engineering. One of the most exciting aspects of prompt engineering in the legal context is customization. Lawyers can tailor AI tools to suit specific needs, whether it's for contract analysis, litigation strategy, or compliance checks. This customization enables a more personalized approach to legal services, enhancing both efficiency and client satisfaction. While the integration of AI and prompt engineering in legal practice offers numerous benefits, it also presents challenges. Data privacy, security, and the risk of over-reliance on AI-generated outputs are significant concerns. Lawyers must be equipped not only with technical skills but also with a keen understanding of these challenges and how to navigate them. Engaging with AI and learning prompt engineering also serves to strengthen a lawyer‚Äôs core analytical skills. It encourages a deeper understanding of legal issues and a more critical approach to information. Lawyers become better equipped to ask the right questions, assess the quality of information, and make informed decisions. Prompt engineering and AI are set to revolutionize how legal services are delivered to clients. From faster turnaround times to more cost-effective solutions, the potential for enhanced client service is immense. Lawyers who embrace this technology will be able to provide a level of service that is not just effective but also innovative and client-centric. In a profession where staying abreast of the latest developments is crucial, prompt engineering is a key skill for staying ahead of the curve. It represents a proactive approach to legal practice, where staying informed about technological advancements is as important as keeping up with the latest legal precedents. The adoption of AI and the mastery of prompt engineering in the legal profession go beyond practical benefits; they inspire a culture of innovation. This culture encourages constant exploration, adaptability, and a willingness to embrace change ‚Äì qualities that are essential for any lawyer navigating the complexities of the 21st-century legal landscape. In conclusion, as the legal profession stands at the crossroads of tradition and innovation, prompt engineering emerges as a critical skill for the modern lawyer. It represents a fusion of legal acumen and technological savvy, positioning lawyers to take full advantage of AI's transformative potential. By mastering this skill, lawyers are not just keeping pace with change; they are charting a new course in legal practice, one that is more efficient, equitable, and aligned with the evolving needs of society. In this AI-augmented future, the legal profession is poised to reach new heights of excellence, driven by a synergy of human judgment and machine intelligence. * Neil Sahota (Ëê®ÂÜ†ÂÜõ) is an IBM Master Inventor, United Nations Artificial Intelligence Advisor, public speaker, and author of the best-seller Own the AI Revolution. See more ¬ª Refine your interests ¬ª

author: Da AE
title: STM mant√©m condena√ß√£o de mulher que se casou com sogro para herdar pens√£o do Ex√©rcito - 15/08/2024 | Di√°rio do Grande ABC
text: O Superior Tribunal Militar (STM) manteve nesta ter√ßa-feira, 13, a condena√ß√£o de uma mulher que se casou com o pr√≥prio sogro, um ex-combatente da Segunda Guerra Mundial, para receber uma pens√£o concedida pelo Ex√©rcito Brasileiro, segundo a decis√£o. A Corte entendeu que houve um esquema de fraude orquestrado por ela e o filho do militar. A mulher que se casou com o sogro se chama Arlete Torres de Andrade. Ela e o ex-marido, Josualdo F√°bio de Andrade Lima, s√£o moradores de Recife (PE) e foram condenados pela Justi√ßa Militar da Uni√£o, no ano passado, por fraude contra o sistema de pens√£o do Ex√©rcito. A Corte considerou que os dois cometeram estelionato e decretou a pena de tr√™s anos de pris√£o. Procurada, a defesa dos dois n√£o respondeu. Em 2012, Arlete se casou com o pai de Josualdo. O idoso, que na √©poca tinha 89 anos, foi combatente na Segunda Guerra Mundial. Ela era 40 anos mais nova que ele. Com Alzheimer, o ex-combatente morreu um ano ap√≥s a formaliza√ß√£o do matrim√¥nio. Um m√™s ap√≥s a morte do idoso, Arlete apresentou um requerimento de habilita√ß√£o de pens√£o. O benef√≠cio foi concedido, e o STM estimou que a mulher recebeu, de 2013 at√© 2021, R$ 435 mil, que em valores atuais somam mais de R$ 919 mil. De acordo com a den√∫ncia do Minist√©rio P√∫blico Militar, Arlete e Josualdo moravam com o idoso. O MP afirma ainda que n√£o √© poss√≠vel atestar que o ex-combatente tinha conhecimento do plano arquitetado pelos dois, devido √† sa√∫de debilitada. Ap√≥s a decis√£o da Justi√ßa Militar, a defesa do casal recorreu da decis√£o no STM. O relator do processo na Corte de Bras√≠lia, o ministro Marco Ant√¥nio de Farias, entendeu que o casal usou do Alzheimer do idoso para formalizar um casamento antes que ele morresse. "O cen√°rio leva o paciente √† dem√™ncia, termo usado para indicar que o indiv√≠duo perdeu sua capacidade de racioc√≠nio, julgamento e mem√≥ria, tornando-se dependente de apoio em suas atividades di√°rias. A doen√ßa √© fatal e, al√©m de deteriorar a mem√≥ria, compromete progressivamente as habilidades da vida di√°ria, causando a perda da capacidade de racioc√≠nio, julgamento e organiza√ß√£o", disse o ministro. O ministro Artur Vidigal de Oliveira discordou do relator e votou nesta ter√ßa-feira para absolver os dois r√©us. Segundo o magistrado, a certid√£o de casamento entre Arlete e o ex-combatente tinha f√© p√∫blica e n√£o poderia ser admitida como fraude. "Como visto nos autos, n√£o h√° comprova√ß√£o inequ√≠voca que a vontade do ex-combatente n√£o tenha sido livre e consciente. H√° a assinatura dele e fotos do casamento, al√©m do ateste do cart√≥rio", afirmou Vidigal. O relator discordou, afirmando que mesmo com a certid√£o de casamento oficial, os fatos mostravam que o enlace era uma fraude. A maioria dos ministros seguiu a interpreta√ß√£o de Marco Ant√¥nio de Farias. Aten√ß√£o! Os coment√°rios do site s√£o via Facebook. Lembre-se de que o coment√°rio √© de inteira responsabilidade do autor e n√£o expressa a opini√£o do jornal. Coment√°rios que violem a lei, a moral e os bons costumes ou violem direitos de terceiros poder√£o ser denunciados pelos usu√°rios e sua conta poder√° ser banida.
